Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA process was procedurally fair given changes in Sri Lanka's conditions
Application_Facts: The civil war in Sri Lanka ended in 2009; by 2011, changes were no longer 'novel'; applicants did not update their PRRA application after permanent residence denial in 2010
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of negative PRRA decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged procedural unfairness in PRRA process
Legal_Standard: Applicants must provide all relevant information; fairness requires disclosure of novel, significant public documents post-application
Assessment_Factor: Timeliness and novelty of country condition changes
Procedural_Issue: Failure to update PRRA application with new information
Evidence_Used: Public documents on Sri Lankaâ€™s post-war conditions
Application_Basis: Permanent Residence Application denied in 2010, followed by PRRA submission
Evidence_Assessed: Changes in Sri Lanka's political and security conditions after 2009
Relief_Sought: Certification of general importance, judicial review granted
Governing_Rule: Applicants must disclose novel and significant developments post-application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Applicants failed to submit updated information about Sri Lanka after 2010
Cause_Description: Applicants sought judicial review after a negative PRRA decision due to alleged unfairness
Evidence_Handling: Court considered whether new evidence needed to be submitted post-application
Evidence_Issues: Failure to disclose potentially relevant public documents post-filing
Evidence_Assessment: Post-2009 developments in Sri Lanka were not deemed novel by 2011
Decision_Rationale: No procedural unfairness because changes in Sri Lanka were not novel at time of PRRA review and applicants had duty to update submissions
Decision_Making_Body: Immigration authorities conducting PRRA, reviewed by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of updated applicant-submitted evidence regarding country conditions
Legal_Standard_Applied: Procedural fairness in administrative decision-making, duty of applicant to disclose material changes
